meanings.definition: A person or thing that annihilates.
meanings.sent1: The superhero was known as the annihilators in the city.
meanings.sent2: The army of robots were the annihilators of the alien invasion.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be the annihilators of the evil monsters in her backyard.
meanings.sent4: In the video game, the player controlled the annihilators to defeat the final boss.
meanings.sent5: The legend spoke of ancient warriors who were the ultimate annihilators of darkness.

meanings.definition: A mathematical operator that combines two elements to produce a third element.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained how to use the annihilators in solving equations.
meanings.sent2: In algebra, the annihilators are used to simplify complex expressions.
meanings.sent3: The mathematician jokingly referred to addition as the friendly annihilators of numbers.
meanings.sent4: The concept of multiplication can be seen as the silent annihilators of repeated addition.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the role of annihilators is crucial in mastering advanced math concepts.
